creator: elango.valluvan@supervalu.com
text:
We have an application deployed in a cluster environment. The application uses log4j and writes the log statements to a single file. The single file is residing in a NAS (common shared) drive and all the managed servers point to the same file while logging information from application.

When my application logs information from two different managed servers, one is getting overwritten by the other. Please find below the log4j configuration we are using. Our application is running in Weblogic Integration 9.2 server.

<appender name="TestApp" class="org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender">
     <param name="MaxFileSize" value="10MB"/>
     <param name="File" value="/work/nfs/shareddrive/logs/TestApp.log"/>
	 <param name="Append" value="true" />
     <layout class="org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout">
     	<param name="ConversionPattern" value="%d{MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss:SSS} %-8p %c - [%x]   %m%n"/>
     </layout>
  </appender>

  <!-- loggers -->
  <category name="TestApp">
        <priority value="debug"/>
        <appender-ref ref="TestApp"/>
  </category>

Is there a fix for this? Please let me know if you have resolved this already.

creator: carnold@apache.org
text: FileAppender's use Java IO and there is no guarantee that writing to the same file from different VMs will have predictable results.  There has been some discussion of writing an appender hierarchy that uses java.nio, but no development has followed.
